meanings.definition: A residential area on the outskirts of a city.
meanings.sent1: Many families in suburbia enjoy the quiet streets and spacious yards.
meanings.sent2: She grew up in suburbia, surrounded by houses and friendly neighbors.
meanings.sent3: In suburbia, the squirrels seem to have their own exclusive club in every backyard.
meanings.sent4: The city skyline loomed in the distance, a reminder of the bustling life beyond suburbia.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set over suburbia, the streetlights flickered on one by one.

meanings.sent1: Suburbia is often seen as a haven for those seeking a quieter lifestyle.
meanings.sent2: They decided to move to suburbia for a change of pace from the city.
meanings.sent3: The gossip in suburbia spreads faster than wildfire on a windy day.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a small fish in a big pond when she first moved to suburbia.
meanings.sent5: The sense of community in suburbia was heartwarming and welcoming.
